sn51.12:4.1: “Mendicants, when the four bases of psychic power are developed and cultivated they’re very fruitful and beneficial.
sn51.12:4.3: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm, and active endeavor.
sn51.12:4.4: They think: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither contracted internally nor scattered externally.’
sn51.12:4.6: as before, so after; as after, so before;
sn51.12:4.7: as below, so above; as above, so below;
sn51.12:4.8: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
sn51.12:4.9: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
sn51.12:5.1: They develop the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to energy …
sn51.12:5.4: They think: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither contracted internally nor scattered externally.’
sn51.12:5.6: as before, so after; as after, so before;
sn51.12:5.7: as below, so above; as above, so below;
sn51.12:5.8: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
sn51.12:5.9: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, they develop a mind that’s full of radiance.
sn51.12:5.10: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way they’re very fruitful and beneficial.
sn51.12:6.1: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, a mendicant wields the many kinds of psychic power:
sn51.12:6.2: multiplying themselves and becoming one again …
sn51.12:6.3: controlling the body as far as the Brahmā realm. …
sn51.12:7.1: When the four bases of psychic power have been developed and cultivated in this way, they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.”
